summary.para: Event IDs for MySQL events that correspond to messages logged to an and events sent to a .
These IDs are also used with to configure the behavior of warnings.
No explicit type for a decimal column.
This event is in the category.
This event uses the payload when used with a .
A byte property is set up to use a MySQL identity column.
This event is in the category.
This event uses the payload when used with a .

member.name: T:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLDatabaseFacadeExtensions
member.summary: MySQL specific extension methods for .

member.name: M:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLDatabaseFacadeExtensions.IsMySql(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Infrastructure.DatabaseFacade)

summary.para: Indicates whether the database provider currently in use is the MySQL provider.

This method can only be used after the has been configured because it is only then that the provider is known. This method cannot be used in because this is where application code sets the provider to use as part of configuring the context.

member.returns: if MySQL is being used; otherwise, .

member.name: F:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLMatchSearchMode.Boolean
member.summary: Perform a boolean search for a string against a text collection.

member.name: M:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLDbFunctionsExtensions.Like``1(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbFunctions,``0,System.String)

summary.para: An implementation of the SQL LIKE operation. In relational databases this is usually directly translated to SQL.

Note that if this function is translated into SQL, then the semantics of the comparison depends on the database configuration. In particular, it may be either case-sensitive or case-insensitive. If this function is evaluated on the client, then it always uses a case-insensitive comparison.

member.param: The property of entity that is to be matched.
A pattern that may involve wildcards %,_,[,],^.
member.returns: if there is a match; otherwise, .

member.name: M:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLDbFunctionsExtensions.Like``1(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbFunctions,``0,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: An implementation of the SQL LIKE operation. In relational databases, this is usually directly translated to SQL.

Note that if this function is translated into SQL, then the semantics of the comparison depends on the database configuration. In particular, it may be either case-sensitive or case-insensitive. If this function is evaluated on the client, then it always uses a case-insensitive comparison.

member.param: The property of entity that is to be matched.
A pattern that may involve wildcards %,_,[,],^.
The escape character (as a single character string) to use in front of %,_,[,],^ if they are not used as wildcards.
member.returns: if there is a match; otherwise, .

member.name: M:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLDbFunctionsExtensions.Match(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbFunctions,System.String[],System.String,MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLMatchSearchMode)

summary.para: An implementation of the SQL MATCH function used to perform a natural language search for a string against a text collection. A collection is a set of one or more columns included in a FULLTEXT index.
MATCH (col1,col2,...) AGAINST (expr [search_modifier])

member.param: The columns of the entity that is to be matched.
A pattern that may involve wildcards %,_,[,],^.
Indicates what type of search to perform
member.returns: if there is a match; otherwise, .

member.name: T:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLEntityTypeExtensions
member.summary: MySQL specific extension methods for entity types.

member.name: M:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLEntityTypeExtensions.GetCharSet(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IReadOnlyEntityType)
member.summary: Get the MySQL character set for the table associated with this entity.
member.returns: The name of the character set.

member.name: M:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLEntityTypeExtensions.SetCharSet(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IMutableEntityType,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the MySQL character set on the table associated with this entity. When you only specify the character set, MySQL implicitly uses the default collation.
member.param: The name of the character set.

member.name: M:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLEntityTypeExtensions.SetCharSet(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IConventionEntityType,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the MySQL character set on the table associated with this entity. When you only specify the character set, MySQL implicitly uses the default collation.
member.param: The name of the character set.
Indicates whether the configuration was specified using a data annotation.
member.returns: The configured value.

member.name: M:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLEntityTypeExtensions.GetCharSetConfigurationSource(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IConventionEntityType)
member.summary: Gets the configuration source for the character set mode.
member.returns: The configuration source.

member.name: M:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLEntityTypeExtensions.SetCollation(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IMutableEntityType,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the MySQL collation on the table associated with this entity. When you specify the collation, MySQL implicitly sets the proper character set as well.

member.name: M:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Extensions.MySQLEntityTypeExtensions.SetCollation(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.IConventionEntityType,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the MySQL collation on the table associated with this entity. When you specify the collation, MySQL implicitly sets the proper character set as well.
member.param: Indicates whether the configuration was specified using a data annotation.
member.returns: The configured value.

member.summary: Gets the configuration source for the collation mode.

summary.para: Adds the services required by the Microsoft SQL Server database provider for Entity Framework to an .

Calling this method is no longer necessary when building most applications, including those that use dependency injection in ASP.NET or elsewhere. It is only needed when building the internal service provider for use with the method. This is not recommended other than for some advanced scenarios.

summary.para: A convention set builder for MySQL.

member.summary: Reduces the node and then calls the method passing the reduced expression. Throws an exception if the node isn't reducible.
member.returns: The expression being visited, or an expression which should replace it in the tree.
member.remarks: Override this method to provide logic to walk the node's children. A typical implementation will call visitor.Visit on each of its children, and if any of them change, should return a new copy of itself with the modified children.

member.name: F:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.Internal.MySQLJsonChangeTrackingOptions.None
member.summary: The default is to serialize everything, which is the most precise, but also the slowest.

member.name: F:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.Internal.MySQLJsonChangeTrackingOptions.CompareRootPropertyOnly
member.summary: Do not track changes inside of JSON mapped properties but only for the root property itself. For example, if the JSON mapped property is a top level array of `int`, then changes to items of the array are not tracked, but changes to the array property itself (the reference) are.

member.name: F:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.Internal.MySQLJsonChangeTrackingOptions.CompareStringRootPropertyByEquals
member.summary: Compare strings as is, without further processing. This means that adding whitespaces between inner properties of a JSON object, that have no effect at all to the JSON object itself, would lead to a change being discovered to the JSON object, resulting in the JSON mapped property being marked as modified.

member.name: F:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.Internal.MySQLJsonChangeTrackingOptions.CompareDomRootPropertyByEquals
member.summary: Only check the JSON root property for DOM objects.

member.name: F:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.Internal.MySQLJsonChangeTrackingOptions.CompareDomSemantically
member.summary: Traverse the DOM to check for changes.

member.name: F:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.Internal.MySQLJsonChangeTrackingOptions.HashDomSemantially
member.summary: Fully traverse the DOM to generate a hash.

member.name: F:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.Internal.MySQLJsonChangeTrackingOptions.HashDomSemantiallyOptimized
member.summary: Traverse part of the DOM to generate a hash.

member.name: F:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.Internal.MySQLJsonChangeTrackingOptions.SnapshotCallsDeepClone
member.summary: Call DeepClone() whenever a type, for which a snapshot needs to be generated, implements it.

member.name: F:MySql.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.Internal.MySQLJsonChangeTrackingOptions.SnapshotCallsClone
member.summary: Call Clone() whenever a type, for which a snapshot needs to be generated, implements it.

summary.para: The service lifetime is . This means that each instance will use its own instance of this service. The implementation may depend on other services registered with any lifetime. The implementation does not need to be thread-safe.
